title: No workaround for advanced indexing
body_html:
I'm trying to do some complex setting of a slice of an intermediate output.
Ideally I want something like:

x[:, ix, :] = y

However, pytorch only seems to allow subsetting in the first dimension:
The following is fine:

x = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.randn(4, 2, 3))
ix = torch.LongTensor([2, 3]) 
x[ix] = y

However when I try and use transposes to get around the slice on the second dimension, this doesn't
work:

x = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.randn(4, 2, 3))
ix = torch.LongTensor([2, 3]) 
x = x.transpose(1, 0)
x[ix] = y
x = x.transpose(0, 1)

Then I get the error message:

RuntimeError: in-place operations can be only used on variables that don't share storage with any other variables, but detected that there are 2 objects sharing it

I have tried all combinations of copying variables etc. but I cannot see a way round how to assign this subslice. Is this a known issue?

body:
I'm trying to do some complex setting of a slice of an intermediate output.
Ideally I want something like:
```python
x[:, ix, :] = y
```
However, pytorch only seems to allow subsetting in the first dimension:
The following is fine:
```python
x = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.randn(4, 2, 3))
ix = torch.LongTensor([2, 3]) 
x[ix] = y
```
However when I try and use transposes to get around the slice on the second dimension, this doesn't 
work:

```python
x = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.randn(4, 2, 3))
ix = torch.LongTensor([2, 3]) 
x = x.transpose(1, 0)
x[ix] = y
x = x.transpose(0, 1)
```
Then I get the error message:
```
RuntimeError: in-place operations can be only used on variables that don't share storage with any other variables, but detected that there are 2 objects sharing it
```
I have tried all combinations of copying variables etc. but I cannot see a way round how to assign this subslice. Is this a known issue?
